disobedience.question: Did you reject the unity of the Church when frustrated with others within?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did you intentionally skip fasting on prescribed days in your daily routine?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

disobedience.question: Have I intentionally become sterilized, disregarding God's plan for my fertility?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately altering one's fertility represents an act of defiance against God and implies we know better than divine wisdom, placing our desires for control above trust in God's plan for our lives.

disobedience.question: Did I speak disrespectfully about the Church, undermining its authority in my words?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

disobedience.question: Did I use words that belittled or ridiculed the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

extracted_data_phrases: in unnecessary physical or mental work

disobedience.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

ambition.question: Did my pursuit of respect, influence, and admiration from others through community involvement and leadership roles let my desire for power and dominance guide my decisions?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to influence how I make decisions, especially when it comes to guiding and leading others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

oppression.question: Have I unjustly used my authority, position, or influence to mistreat others?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

lust.question: Did I reduce others to their usefulness, rather than seeing them in my mind's eye as people worthy of love and respect?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: such as walking or golfing , and volunteering to solely my own initiative and determination ,
to solely my own initiative and determination
autonomy.question: Did I attribute my leisurely pursuits, such as walking or golfing, and volunteering to solely my own initiative and determination, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: such as leisurely activities or volunteering
rather than acknowledging God 's providence in guiding me
autonomy.question: Did I attribute my accomplishments, such as leisurely activities or volunteering, to my own abilities rather than acknowledging God's providence in guiding me?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and use words to speak harshly or offend others?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: with harsh , unseemly words in public settings
incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and speak to others with harsh, unseemly words in public settings?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and speak to others with vulgarity in your conversations during social gatherings or when interacting with friends?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, leading me to neglect my physical health and well-being?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking while being less concerned than reasonable about maintaining a balanced relationship between your needs and those of others?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: such as golfing or leisurely walking
prodigality.question: Have I prioritized recreational activities, such as golfing or leisurely walking, over my financial responsibilities to provide for my family's needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: for leisure activities over meeting my essential responsibilities
prodigality.question: Have I excessively risked financial resources entrusted to me for leisure activities over meeting my essential responsibilities?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: in sharing or discussing others ' private affairs
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing or discussing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in sharing others ' private affairs through conversation
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs through conversation, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I shared others' confidential information, even if what I disclosed was true, with people who were not directly involved in their lives?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: for work that could have been avoided
impiety.question: Did you use Sunday, a day consecrated to rest and worship, for work that could have been avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).
